decision_conditions: The proposed side dormer and roof extensions, viewed cumulatively, would, by reason of their design, scale and bulk at roof level, appear as a visually intrusive and incongruous development  which is harmful to the character of the street scene and the building's appearance, contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and Havering's Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.

The proposed side dormer would, by reason of its siting and design incorporating openings facing the neighbouring property, appear as an unneighbourly development which adversely impacts amenity by way of loss of privacy and overlooking between the two properties, contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and the relevant polices of the London Plan and NPPF.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent on 20/7/20.
description: First floor extension to create new first floor accommodation to include side dormer windows. Two storey rear extension with Juliette balcony and new front porch extension.
